definition: to begin/to initiate/to inaugurate/to start/to create
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview

sentences.english: That is where Goold and Campbell's other innovation comes in.
sentences.chinese: 這就是古爾德和坎貝爾的其他創見所在。

sentences.english: Its wide coverage and originality are the typical traits.
sentences.chinese: 論及範圍寬泛，富於創見性，是這部著作的顯著特點。

sentences.english: Among Zhu Xi's disciples, Chen Chun is considered to be one who had more inventions and original idea.
sentences.chinese: 在朱熹門人中，陳淳被認爲是多有發明和創見的一位。

sentences.english: The original  organ organization was  originated with an  original man.
sentences.chinese: 最初的風琴組織是由一個有創見的人發起的。

sentences.english: He has lots of original ideas about the research into microelectronics.
sentences.chinese: 他對微電子學的研究很有創見。

sentences.english: Does this concept provide insightful additions or an added confusions?
sentences.chinese: 這個概念帶來了什麼創見，抑或是困擾？

sentences.english: Some fresh ideas begin to surface.
sentences.chinese: 有一些創見性的意見開始顯露。

definition: to elucidate/to expound/to study and explain
to take an alternate route (idiom)/to find an alternative/to take a different approach/to blaze a new trail
see 承前啟後|承前启后[cheng2 qian2 qi3 hou4]
